Summary I’m a detail oriented individual highly skilled at prioritizing and organizing. I’m a quick learner, a team player with excellent communication skills. An experienced circuit analyzer, designer, and repairer, that is familiar with most electrical components and hardware methodologies; including, methodologies like semiconductor manufacturing processes and safety guidelines. I’m also experienced with object oriented programming and various languages such as C/C++, C#, JAVA, Machine Code, VHDL, and Assembly Code; including, interpreter languages like Ruby. I can quickly learn and adapt to programming languages and programming practices such as “Unit Testing”. Furthermore, I have experience with network devices, network protocols, and Cisco router configurations. The majority of my networking experience comes through training on Cisco CCNA and CompTia A+ curriculums. In addition, I have also completed over 600 hours of internships assisting other Network technicians in maintaining phone lines, Ethernet lines, switches, routers and repairing PCs with hardware and software issues. I’m a well rounded individual that enjoys learning different aspects of computer technology and enthusiastic to begin my career in the computer engineering industry. Summary I was trained by the US Navy as a Nuclear Propulsion Plant Mechanical Operator. I received training for the Electrical and Reactor theory for operating a Nuclear Reactor. After my Naval tour while employed by Raytheon Technical Services Corporation, I was educated and became proficient in shipboard electrical and electronic systems installations. My projects have included; Rolling Airframe Missile System, Internal Shipboard Communications Systems (using cat5 and Fiber optics), Shipboard Navigation Systems (Voyage Management System, Situational Awareness Bridge Display System). I also became proficient in dismantling and building cable connectors. While employed by Intel, I was trained to maintain and operate many different toolsets and equipment associated with the manufacturing of semiconductors at the highest skill level with the utmost regard to safety and quality.
